response:
Force bends silent mass
Push or pull shapes what will move
Change begins in touch

Momentum flows
Mass times speed held through motion
Stillness waits its loss

Acceleration
Speed shifts with passing seconds
Curves in spacetime form

Velocity speaks
Speed with a chosen direction
Arrows through the void

Position marks place
Here defined against all space
Now fixed by a frame

Gravity whispers
Curving paths of light and dust
Falling without sound

Inertia waits
Mass resists the call to change
Stillness has weight too

prompt: Write a haiku about rigid body.
response:
Rigid body turns
Parts locked in shared geometry
One spin binds them all

Moment twists the beam
Force meets arm in quiet math
Rotation is born

Rotation unfolds
Circles traced in silent time
Axes hold their ground

Lagrangian hums
Paths chosen by least action
Nature solves itself

Hamiltonian
Energy maps phase space flow
Time steps without loss

Motion writes the path
Change traced through space and through time
Stillness is a case

Conservation holds
What is gained is always lost
Books stay balanced tight

Constant stands unchanged
Through the shifting math of worlds
Anchor in the flux

Friction steals motion
Heat blooms where surfaces meet
Speed fades into rest

Oscillator swings
Energy trades form in time
Rhythm never dies

Spring remembers shape
Pulled apart then pulled back home
Force sleeps in the coil

Pendulum counts time
Arc repeats with patient grace
Gravity keeps beat

Rocket burns below
Mass escapes to climb the sky
Earth lets go slowly

Frame defines the view
Motion shifts with who observes
Truth needs reference

Non-inertial frame
Fictitious forces arise
Spins bend what feels real

Time moves without speed
Moments stack in ordered flow
Change is its shadow

Orbit loops in trust
Fall forever, never land
Balance writes the curve

Energy transforms
Never lost, only reshaped
Work and heat exchange
